page.title: 11RECREATION
page.content: Because of Tewkesbury's position on the rivers Avon and Severn it is understandable that a boating industry and sailing clubs have developed.Also there is a local angling association and Tewkesbury boasts good fishing for elvers. Behind the Abbey is a large recreation area known as 'The Vineyards' where there are soccer and rugby pitches. The town has its own swimming complex incorporating a main pool and learner,a sauna and a solarium. Tewkesbury has a fine golf course with a municiple course near-by at Cleeve Hill,which overlooks the Cheltenham race course. The town has clubs for bowls,cricket,squash,soccer and rugby,with the majority of public houses having pool and skittle teams.
